curam.util.client.domain
Class ClientDomainOptions

java.lang.Object
  curam.util.common.plugin.AbstractPlugIn
      curam.util.common.domain.AbstractDomainPlugIn
          curam.util.common.domain.DefaultMutableDomainOptions
              curam.util.client.domain.ClientDomainOptions
All Implemented Interfaces:
DomainOptions, DomainPlugIn, curam.util.common.domain.MutableDomainOptions, PlugIn
public class ClientDomainOptions
extends curam.util.common.domain.DefaultMutableDomainOptions

Provides client-specific accessors for the options defined in the UML model. This is an enhanced implementation of the default options plug-in. Instances of this plug-in provide accessors that perform the data conversions required to convert the option values used in the model into the appropriate Java data-type.

Constructor Detail

public ClientDomainOptions()
The default constructor.

Method Detail

init

public void init(DomainConverter converter)
          throws DomainException
Initializes all of the fields from the wrapped option values by parsing and storing them in their native type where appropriate.

Parameters:
converter - Converter that can parse the domain-specific option values.
Throws:
DomainException - If the options cannot be parsed.

getDisplayedDefault

public java.lang.Object getDisplayedDefault()
Gets the default value that will be displayed when a field on a form has no source value specified to initialize it. This default value is defined in the UML model. If it is not defined, then the assumed domain default value, used when an empty field is submitted, should be used as the displayed default value.

Returns:
The displayed default value; null if the assumed domain default applies.

getMaxValue

public java.lang.Object getMaxValue()
Gets the maximum value that the domain value may have when validated.

Returns:
The maximum value, or null if none applies.

getMinValue

public java.lang.Object getMinValue()
Gets the minimum value that the domain value must equal or exceed when validated.

Returns:
The minimum value, or null if none applies.

getMaxSize

public int getMaxSize()
Gets the maximum number of characters or bytes that a string or BLOB domain value may contain when validated.

Returns:
The maximum size, or zero if no limit applies.

getMinSize

public int getMinSize()
Gets the minimum number of characters or bytes that a string or BLOB domain value may contain when validated.

Returns:
The minimum size, or zero if no limit applies.

getPattern

public java.util.regex.Pattern getPattern()
Gets the pattern that the domain value must match when validated.

Returns:
The pattern, or null if no pattern applies.

isCompressed

public boolean isCompressed()
Indicates whether or not the submitted field value should have all sequences of whitespace characters compressed to a single space character and all leading and trailing whitespace removed before parsing.

Returns:
true if compression is required.

isLeadingTrimmed

public boolean isLeadingTrimmed()
Indicates whether or not the submitted field value should have leading whitespace trimmed before parsing. If compression is enabled, then leading whitespace will be trimmed even if this option is not enabled.

Returns:
true if trimming is required.

isTrailingTrimmed

public boolean isTrailingTrimmed()
Indicates whether or not the submitted field value should have trailing whitespace trimmed before parsing. If compression is enabled, then trailing whitespace will be trimmed even if this option is not enabled.

Returns:
true if trimming is required.

isUpperCased

public boolean isUpperCased()
Indicates if the submitted field value should be converted to upper-case before it is parsed.

Returns:
true if conversion to upper-case is required.

getCodeTableName

public java.lang.String getCodeTableName()
Gets the name of the code-table associated with a domain.

Returns:
The code-table name.

isCodeTableRoot

public boolean isCodeTableRoot()
Indicates whether or not the domain is a code-table root domain. This option is inherited (unlike in the UML model), so a real code-table root domain is one whose parent domain is not also a code-table root.

Returns:
true if this is a code-table root, false otherwise.

setCodeTableName

protected void setCodeTableName(java.lang.String codeTableName)
Sets the name of the code-table associated with a domain.

Parameters:
codeTableName - The code-table name.

setCodeTableRoot

protected void setCodeTableRoot(boolean isCodeTableRoot)
Sets whether or not the domain is a code-table root domain.

Parameters:
isCodeTableRoot - true if this is a code-table root.

setDisplayedDefault

protected void setDisplayedDefault(java.lang.Object displayedDefault)

Parameters:
displayedDefault - The displayed default value; null if the assumed domain default applies.
